Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.@Core.Description: Terms describing capabilities of a service
Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.@Core.LongDescription:
There are some capabilities which are strongly recommended for services to support even
though they are optional. Support for $top and $skip is a good example as
supporting these query options helps with performance of a service and are essential. Such
capabilities are assumed to be default capabilities of an OData service even in
the case that a capabilities annotation doesn’t exist. Capabilities annotations are
mainly expected to be used to explicitly specify that a service doesn’t support such
capabilities. Capabilities annotations can as well be used to declaratively
specify the support of such capabilities.

On the other hand, there are some capabilities that a service may choose to support or
not support and in varying degrees. $filter and $orderby are such good examples.
This vocabulary aims to define terms to specify support or no support for such
capabilities.

A service is assumed to support by default the following capabilities even though an
annotation doesn’t exist:
- Countability ($count)
- Client pageability ($top, $skip)
- Expandability ($expand)
- Indexability by key
- Batch support ($batch)
- Navigability of navigation properties

A service is expected to support the following capabilities. If not supported, the
service is expected to call out the restrictions using annotations:
- Filterability ($filter)
- Sortability ($orderby)
- Queryability of top level entity sets
- Query functions

A client cannot assume that a service supports certain capabilities. A client can try, but
it needs to be prepared to handle an error in case the following capabilities are not
supported:
- Insertability
- Updatability
- Deletability

ConformanceLevel.@Core.Description: The conformance level achieved by this service

SupportedFormats.@Core.Description: Media types of supported formats, including format parameters

SupportedMetadataFormats.@Core.Description: Media types of supported formats for $metadata, including format parameters

AcceptableEncodings.@Core.Description: List of acceptable compression methods for ($batch) requests, e.g. gzip

AsynchronousRequestsSupported.@Core.Description: Service supports the asynchronous request preference

BatchContinueOnErrorSupported.@Core.Description: Service supports the continue on error preference. Supports $batch requests. Services that apply the BatchContinueOnErrorSupported term should also specify the ContinueOnErrorSupported property from the BatchSupport term.

IsolationLevel.Snapshot@Core.Description: All data returned for a request, including multiple requests within a batch or results retrieved across multiple pages, will be consistent as of a single point in time

CrossJoinSupported.@Core.Description: Supports cross joins for the entity sets in this container

CallbackSupported.@Core.Description: Supports callbacks for the specified protocols

CallbackProtocols.@Core.Description: List of supported callback protocols, e.g. `http` or `wss`

CallbackType.@Core.Description: A non-empty collection lists the full set of supported protocols. A empty collection means 'only HTTP is supported'

UrlTemplate.@Core.Description: URL Template including parameters. Parameters are enclosed in curly braces {} as defined in RFC6570

DocumentationUrl.@Core.Description: Human readable description of the meaning of the URL Template parameters

ChangeTracking.@Core.Description: Change tracking capabilities of this service or entity set

Supported.@Core.Description: This entity set supports the odata.track-changes preference

FilterableProperties.@Core.Description: Change tracking supports filters on these properties

ExpandableProperties.@Core.Description: Change tracking supports these properties expanded

CountRestrictions.@Core.Description: Restrictions on /$count path suffix and $count=true system query option

NonCountableProperties.@Core.Description: These collection properties do not allow /$count segments

NonCountableNavigationProperties.@Core.Description: These navigation properties do not allow /$count segments

NavigationRestrictions.@Core.Description: Restrictions on navigating properties according to OData URL conventions

RestrictedProperties.@Core.Description: List of navigation properties with restrictions

Navigability.@Core.Description: Navigation properties can be navigated to this level

FilterFunctions.@Core.Description: List of functions and operators supported in $filter. If null, all functions and operators may be attempted.

NavigationType.Recursive@Core.Description: Navigation properties can be recursively navigated
NavigationType.Single@Core.Description: Navigation properties can be navigated to a single level

IndexableByKey.@Core.Description: Supports key values according to OData URL conventions

BatchSupported.@Core.Description: Supports $batch requests. Services that apply the BatchSupported term should also apply the more comprehensive BatchSupport term.

ContinueOnErrorSupported.@Core.Description: Service supports the continue on error preference

ReferencesInRequestBodiesSupported.@Core.Description: Service supports Content-ID referencing in request bodies

ReferencesAcrossChangeSetsSupported.@Core.Description: Service supports Content-ID referencing across change sets

EtagReferencesSupported.@Core.Description: Service supports referencing Etags from previous requests

FilterFunctions.@Core.Description: List of functions and operators supported in $filter

RequiredProperties.@Core.Description: These properties must be specified in the $filter clause (properties of derived types are not allowed here)

NonFilterableProperties.@Core.Description: These structural or navigation properties cannot be used in $filter expressions

FilterExpressionRestrictions.@Core.Description: These properties only allow a subset of expressions

MaxLevels.@Core.Description: The maximum number of levels (including recursion) that can be traversed in a $filter expression. A value of -1 indicates there is no restriction.

@Validation.AllowedValues.@Core.Description: Property can be used in a single eq clause
Property can be used in a single in clause
Property can be used in at most one ge and/or one le clause, separated by and
String property can be used as first operand in startswith, endswith, and contains clauses

AscendingOnlyProperties.@Core.Description: These properties can only be used for sorting in Ascending order

DescendingOnlyProperties.@Core.Description: These properties can only be used for sorting in Descending order

NonSortableProperties.@Core.Description: These structural or navigation properties cannot be used in $orderby expressions

NonExpandableProperties.@Core.Description: These properties cannot be used in $expand expressions

MaxLevels.@Core.Description: The maximum number of levels that can be expanded in a $expand expression. A value of -1 indicates there is no restriction.

SearchExpressions.AND@Core.Description: Multiple search terms separated by AND
SearchExpressions.OR@Core.Description: Multiple search terms separated by OR
SearchExpressions.phrase@Core.Description: Search phrases enclosed in double quotes
SearchExpressions.group@Core.Description: Precedence grouping of search expressions with parentheses

NonInsertableNavigationProperties.@Core.Description: These navigation properties do not allow deep inserts

MaxLevels.@Core.Description: The maximum number of navigation properties that can be traversed when addressing the collection to insert into. A value of -1 indicates there is no restriction.

DeepInsertSupport.@Core.Description: Deep Insert Support of the annotated resource (the whole service, an entity set, or a collection-valued resource)

ContentIDSupported.@Core.Description: Annotation target supports accepting and returning nested entities annotated with the `Core.ContentID` instance annotation.

NonUpdatableNavigationProperties.@Core.Description: These navigation properties do not allow rebinding

MaxLevels.@Core.Description: The maximum number of navigation properties that can be traversed when addressing the collection or entity to update. A value of -1 indicates there is no restriction.

NonDeletableNavigationProperties.@Core.Description: These navigation properties do not allow DeleteLink requests

MaxLevels.@Core.Description: The maximum number of navigation properties that can be traversed when addressing the collection to delete from or the entity to delete. A value of -1 indicates there is no restriction.

CustomHeaders.@Core.Description: Custom headers that are supported/required for the annotated resource

@Core.Example@Capabilities.CustomHeaders.Name: X-CSRF-Token
@Core.Example@Capabilities.CustomHeaders.Description: Token to protect against Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks

ExampleValues.Description: Can be used on HEAD request to the service document for obtaining a new CSRF token. This token must then be sent in subsequent requests to resources of the service.

CustomQueryOptions.@Core.Description: Custom query options that are supported/required for the annotated resource
CustomQueryOptions.@Core.LongDescription: If the entity container is annotated, the query option is supported/required by all resources in that container.

ExampleValues.Description: Service responds with self-contained HTML document that can conveniently viewed in a browser and gives access to the response body, response headers, URL parsing information, and stack trace
Service responds with JSON document that contains the same information as the HTML debug response

CustomParameter.@Core.Description: A custom parameter is either a header or a query option
CustomParameter.@Core.LongDescription: The type of a custom parameter is always a string. Restrictions on the parameter values can be expressed by annotating the record expression describing the parameter with terms from the Validation vocabulary, e.g. Validation.Pattern or Validation.AllowedValues.

Required.@Core.Description: true: parameter is required, false or not specified: parameter is optional

ExampleValues.@Core.Description: Example values for the custom parameter

Value.@Core.Description: Example value for the custom parameter
